solution_line_template: If {boxes_sf} square feet represents one-quarter of the second floor storage space, then the second floor has {boxes_sf}*{second_floor_fraction_denominator}=<<{boxes_sf}*{second_floor_fraction_denominator}={second_floor_total_sf}>>{second_floor_total_sf} square feet of storage space.

Since the first floor has twice as much space as the second floor, then the first floor has {second_floor_total_sf}*{first_floor_multiplier}=<<{second_floor_total_sf}*{first_floor_multiplier}={first_floor_total_sf}>>{first_floor_total_sf} square feet of storage space.

Altogether, when empty, the entire building has {second_floor_total_sf}+{first_floor_total_sf}=<<{second_floor_total_sf}+{first_floor_total_sf}={total_building_sf}>>{total_building_sf} square feet of storage space.

Since the second floor has {boxes_sf} square feet of storage space filled with boxes, then there are {total_building_sf}-{boxes_sf}={available_sf} square feet of unused storage space still available in the building.
